subject: Music
title: Bob Dylan and the Folk Revival
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bob Dylan and the Folk Revival.

hook.text: Bob Dylan sang that the times were changing â€” and for once, a songwriter was right.

buildup.text: The folk revival of the 1960s turned acoustic guitars into weapons against injustice.

discovery.text: Blowin' in the Wind asked questions about war and freedom that still have no easy answers.

twist.text: When Dylan plugged in an electric guitar at Newport, folk purists booed him off stage.

climax.text: He won the Nobel Prize in Literature â€” proving songs can be poetry.

punchline.text: He asked the questions. Fifty years later, we're still answering them.

quiz.question: Why was Bob Dylan booed at the Newport Folk Festival?
options: He played an electric guitar, which folk purists rejected
He arrived late to the concert
